ErrorIndex.title: Wrapper for index information inside an error.

ErrorResponse.description: Generic error response for REST APIs

code.description: the numeric HTTP error code for the response.

details.description: The optional details of the error response.

dictionary.description:
Dictionary/map of associated data/information relevant to the error.
The error "message" may contain {{name}} escapes that should be substituted
with information from this dictionary.

domain.description:
The "domain" for the error.  If empty, it is an EDA
core error.  Alternatively it can be an EDA application
"apiVersion" value (e.g. interfaces.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1)
indicating that the error is specific to that application.
The domain gives the receiver information that they can use
to help them interpret the "internal" error code value, or
to find an internationalization translation for the message.

errors.description:
Collection of errors in cases where more than one exists. This needs to be
flexible so we can support multiple formats

internal.description: Internal error code in cases where we don't have an array of errors

message.description: The basic text error message for the error response.

ref.description: Reference to the error source. Should typically be the URI of the request

type.description:
URI pointing at a document that describes the error and mitigation steps
If there is no document, point to the RFC for the HTTP error code

Status.title: Status is a return value for calls that don't return other objects.

com.nokia.eda.config.v1alpha1.Configlet.description: Configlet is the Schema for the configlets API

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: The apiVersion must be set to config.eda.nokia.com/v1alpha1
The kind must be set to Configlet

spec.description:
Configlet is a configuration snippet that can be applied to a set of targets.
The path on the target is provided in jspath notation, and the configuration is provided as a JSON string.
Configlets can be applied to a set of targets based on a label selector, a list of targets, or a combination of both.

configs.description: Configurations to apply, being sets of paths, operations and JSON configurations.

config.description: JSON-formatted string representing the configuration to apply.
config.title: Configuration

operation.description: Indicates the operation in which to apply the configuration.
operation.title: Operation

path.description: Path to apply the configuration in jspath notation, including any keys if relevant, e.g. .system.information.
path.title: Path

configs.title: Configurations

endpointSelector.description: Label selector to use to match targets to deploy Configlet to.
endpointSelector.title: Target Selector

endpoints.description: Reference to targets to deploy Configlet to.
endpoints.title: Targets

operatingSystem.description: Operating system to match against when selecting targets.
operatingSystem.title: Operating System

priority.description: Priority of this Configlet, between -100 and 100. Higher priorities overwrite lower priorities in the event of conflicts.
priority.title: Priority

version.description: Version to match against when selecting targets.
version.title: Version

spec.title: Specification

ui-conditions.condition: (spec.endpointSelector !== undefined && Array.isArray(spec.endpointSelector) && spec.endpointSelector.length > 0) || (spec.endpoints !== undefined && Array.isArray(spec.endpoints) && spec.endpoints.length > 0) || (typeof spec.operatingSystem === 'string' && spec.operatingSystem !== '')
ui-conditions.errorMsg: Endpoints, Endpoint Selector, or Operating System must be populated

endpoints.description: List of targets this configlet has been applied to.
endpoints.title: Targets

com.nokia.eda.config.v1alpha1.ConfigletL.description: ConfigletList is a list of configlets

x-eda-nokia-com.ui-pattern-error: A valid name is made up of one or more components where each component is separated by period characters.  Each component must start and end with a lower case alphanumeric character and the body of the component is made up of zero or more lower case alphanumeric and hyphen characters.
